law.catch_line: Judgment of Circuit Court -- Appeal to Court of Appeals.
law.text: Upon final submission of any action brought under KRS 278.410, the Circuit Court shall enter a judgment either sustaining the order of the commission or setting it aside or vacating it in whole or in part, or modifying it, or remanding it to the commission with instructions. Any final order of the commission, on remand of the proceedings, shall be subject to court review in the same manner as any other final order of the commission. Either party to the action may appeal from the judgment of the Circuit Court to the Court of Appeals in accordance with the Rules of Civil Procedure.
law.history: Amended 1976 Ky. Acts ch. 62, sec. 111. -- Amended 1960 Ky. Acts ch. 104, sec. 18, effective June 16, 1960. -- Amended 1952 Ky. Acts ch. 46, sec. 5. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. secs. 3952-50, 3952-51.
